snippet: Long after the economy rebounds, states will face financial problems that include rising health care costs and underfunded pensions, a task force of budget experts said.
abstract: Report issued by the State Budget Crisis Task Force, which was chaired by Richard Ravitch and Paul A Volcker, predicts that the fiscal crisis for states will persist long after the national economy rebounds; report notes that the 2008 financial collapse exposed deep-set financial challenges that will worsen if no action is taken.

byline.original: By MARY WILLIAMS WALSH and MICHAEL COOPER
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from New York.
